title: Enable printable Resident Profile report matching provided layout

requirements.text: Implement working print functionality from the Maui resident profile page so that clicking the existing “Print” button generates a printout that follows the layout and structure shown in the uploaded reference image (print.JPG).

quotes: enable print and follow the layout in the image provided

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking the “Print” button on Resident Profile triggers the browser print dialog and prints content (not a placeholder toast).

The printed output matches the reference layout at a high level: a top header area with facility/app name and report title, followed by clearly separated sections with divider lines, and a multi-page print-friendly flow.

The printed output includes the key sections visible in the reference image: Resident Information, Insurance Information, Active Medications (table-style grid), Discontinued Medications section, Assigned Physicians, Pharmacy Information, and Responsible Contacts.
The “Include physician printed name & signature” toggle affects the printed output (when enabled, the print layout includes a signature/printed-name area; when disabled, it is omitted).
Non-print UI elements (app header/nav/footer, page action buttons, tabs UI, edit/add medication buttons) do not appear in the printed document.

requirements.text: Add print-specific styling so the Resident Profile report paginates cleanly and remains readable when printed (A4/Letter), including consistent typography, spacing, section dividers, and table formatting aligned with the uploaded reference image.

quotes: follow the layout in the image provided

acceptanceCriteria: The print stylesheet uses @media print rules to hide non-print elements and optimize spacing/typography for paper.
Active Medications prints as a grid/table with column headers and row borders similar to the reference, and it can span multiple pages without overlapping content.
Sections avoid awkward page breaks where possible (e.g., headings not left orphaned at the bottom of a page).
The printed page does not include dark backgrounds, shadows, or UI card chrome that reduces legibility on paper.

constraints: Do not modify files in frontend immutablePaths (including Internet Identity hooks and frontend/src/components/ui). Compose using existing components instead.
Keep backend unchanged unless strictly required; printing must be achievable entirely on the frontend for the current mock data.
nonGoals: Do not add PDF generation or server-side rendering/export.
Do not implement real backend persistence for resident data as part of this print enablement.
